result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael John Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael John Long is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael John Long was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction for 1 year.
Counts 2 through 8 are dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation September 30, 2014 by 3:00 p.m.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent.

-Cooperate with any other assessment or programming as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Ann Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Michael John Long appeared. Case called at 3:59 pm. ADA Correll makes statement and presents DP to the court. No objection from Atty Caton.   Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one and nine, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count 1 and 9. Court withholds entering conviction on count 1 for in favor of DP agreement. Counts 2-8 are dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguements. Defendant makes statement. On count 9 court orders:
1 year Probation S/W
- Restitution
- Court Costs; Apply money on file
- 60 Days condition time STAYED
- AODA within 30 Days
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent
- Cooperate with any other assessment or programming as directed by Agent
 - Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
 - Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Random UA's and PBTS
- Follow all rules and regulation of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- To report to probation by 3:00 pm on 9/30/2014
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

-Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Westconsin Credit Union all offices.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
